subject: Re: [junit] JUnit behaviour
msgSnippet: ... Yep... a lot of sense (otherwise I would have said it is a quite a bug :-) ). ./alex -- .w( the_mindstorm )p. TestNG co-founder EclipseTestNG Creator
messageBody:
On 09 Apr 2007 07:04:16 -0700, Ilja Preuss <it@...> wrote:
>
> Seems I failed to make myself clear.
>
> Imagine two classes
>
> class Super {
> @Before void beforeSuper() ..
> ]
>
> class Sub extends Super {
> @Before void beforeSub1() ...
> @Before void beforeSub2() ...
> }
>
> My educated guess is that beforeSuper will always be executed first, but
> that there is no guarantee whatsoever in which order beforeSub1 and
> beforeSub2 will be executed.
>
> Does that make sense?
>

Yep... a lot of sense (otherwise I would have said it is a quite a bug :-) ).

./alex
--
.w( the_mindstorm )p.
TestNG co-founder
EclipseTestNG Creator

> Cheers, Ilja
>
> Alexandru Popescu ☀ schrieb:
>
> > On 09 Apr 2007 05:09:30 -0700, Ilja Preuss <it@...> wrote:
> >> My first guess without a closer look at the code would be that it's done
> >> so that @Before(Class) methods in subclasses are run before those in
> >> superclasses.
> >>
> >> I don't think there is any guarantee on the order of methods inside one
> >> class. I could be wrong, though.
> >>
> >
> > If so, then I would say that this is a possible problem. The
> > invocation order should follow the one of initialization and TestNG is
> > trying to guarantee this rule (where the superclass is firstly
> > initialized), otherwise this is quite a limitation (imagine a scenario
> > where the parent class initializes some test data, and the child will
> > need to customize it - this will never work).
> >
> > bests,
> >
> > ./alex
> > --
> > .w( the_mindstorm )p.
> > TestNG co-founder
> > EclipseTestNG Creator
> >> Cheers, Ilja
> >>
> >> jonhnnyweslley schrieb:
> >> > I was creating tests, when in any test I dont understand a behaviour
> >> > of the framework. The Junit framework executes Before and BeforeClass
> >> > test methods in reverse order. Why?
> >> >
> >> > In TestIntrospector I find the below code, but I dont understand the
> >> > cause.
> >> >
> >> > public List<Method> getTestMethods(
> >> > Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass) {
> >> > ...
> >> > if (runsTopToBottom(annotationClass))
> >> > Collections.reverse(results);
> >> > return results;
> >> > }
> >> >
> >> > private boolean runsTopToBottom(
> >> > Class< ? extends Annotation> annotation) {
> >> > return annotation.equals(Before.class) ||
> >> > annotation.equals(BeforeClass.class);
> >> > }
> >> >
> >> >
> >> >
> >> >
